title: What comes next in Google's antitrust case over search?
description: The U.S. Department of Justice is expected on Tuesday to tell a judge what actions Alphabet's Google should take after he ruled in August that it illegally monopolized online search in the United States, the latest step in a long legal process.
content: Here is what has happened so far in the case and what comes next. Oct. 20, 2020 - The Justice Department sues Google alleging that it illegally monopolized the online search and related advertising markets, the first time in a generation that the U.S. government accused a Big Tech corporation of an illegal monopoly. Sept. 12, 2023 - Google defends its practices at a trial before U.S. District Judge Amit Mehta in Washington, saying it had won its market share by providing a high-quality service. Nov. 16, 2023 - The trial's evidence phase concludes, after Google CEO Sundar Pichai took the stand and acknowledged the importance of making its search engine the default on phones and other devices.
